text: Frailty criteria Definition Reduced muscle Weakness as assessed by grip strength measured by a hand held strength dynamometer. A patient has three attempts with the dominant hand. The mean is calculated and adjusted for gender and BMI. Weakness is defined as grip strength in the lowest 20t percentile of a community dwelling population aged 65 years or older. Unintentional weight Weight loss of 4.5 kilograms (10 pounds) or more in the last 12 loss months. Exhaustion Patient is asked to rate how often in the last week they felt like the following two statements were true: (i) | felt everything I did was an effort (ii) I could not get going. 0 = rarely, 1 = some of the time, 2 = moderate amount of time, 3 = most of the time. A score of 2 or 3 on either statement is defined as exhaustion Low physical activity A validated questionnaire is used to assess the physical activities a patient has performed in the previous 2 weeks. From this questionnaire the weekly kilocalorie consumption is estimated. If it is below the 20 percentile for their gender, they are classified as having low physical activity. Slow walking A patient is timed while they walk a distance of 4.5m (15 feet) three times. The average of the three walks is calculated and adjusted for gender and height. If it is in the lowest 20â„¢ percentile the patient is scored as being a slow walker.
